alert.note: Alert for Ellis (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 8:46AM CDT until October 29 at 1:22AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Ellis and Kaufman. * WHEN...Until noon CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is ongoing or imminent. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through urban drainage systems. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the cities of Scurry and Kaufman. Between 6 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waxahachie, Ennis, Terrell, Red Oak, Kaufman, Palmer, Bardwell, Grays Prairie, Alma, Cottonwood, Bardwell Lake, Garrett, Scurry, Bristol, Pecan Hill, Oak Grove, Post Oak Bend City, Rosser, Oak Ridge and Crisp.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
